intro: Erythraea tenuiflora var. pseudolinariifolia, commonly known as the narrow-flowered erythraea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The leaves are typically linear and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variant is closely related to E. tenuiflora but differs in its floral structure and leaf morphology. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
